column5:
The past few days have honestly just been the worst so I haven‚Äôt done much of anything except sit around and cry. I was with my sibling last night & his kids and it helped a little but the pain was still overwhelming. I finally managed to get a little sleep last night with the help of a sleep aid, but then I dreamt about him so waking up was really horrible. I just wanted to go back to sleep and see his face again. I miss him so incredibly much and I don‚Äôt know how I‚Äôm supposed to live my life without him. It feels so wrong and awful. 

I‚Äôm going to take your advice and try to make a list of small things to do. Anything to distract me. I know he wouldn‚Äôt want for me to be this miserable but it‚Äôs hard not to be.

That‚Äôs how I feel as well.. like I might experience fleeting moments of happiness at some point but I‚Äôll never truly be as happy as I was with him in my life. I feel like a huge part of me is just gone and i‚Äôll never get it back. Nothing can ever fill that void and the emptiness stings. All I want is to tell him how much he meant to me one last time. I know I‚Äôm not in the best headspace right now but if you ever wanna talk and just vent let me know. I feel like we relate a lot on how we feel. Again, I‚Äôm so sorry you‚Äôre going through this. Your husband sounds like he was an amazing person who made you feel important and loved. I‚Äôll never regret having that even if it means feeling this pain, but man does it hurt üòû

Thank you for your kind words and I‚Äôm sorry for your loss, too. ‚ô•Ô∏è I‚Äôve had a few comments from other people experiencing the same loss and pain and I can only hope we are all able to find some peace.

I‚Äôm so sorry. I know we‚Äôve already spoken briefly because of my last post, but I just want to extend my condolences for your loss, too. I‚Äôm with my brother and his kids tonight trying to distract myself a little bit but I‚Äôm still in so much pain. I‚Äôm so sorry you lost your husband and the father of your children. It sounds like we felt the same way about our guys, mine was my absolute best friend in the world, too. I wish I could offer more comforting words but I‚Äôm still in shock myself and wish none of this were real. I wish I could give you a hug.
Thank you for your kind words ‚ô•Ô∏è
Thank you so much I think talking to someone would definitely help. I‚Äôve been sort of reclusive today and I feel just awful. I‚Äôve done nothing but lay in bed and cry.

I keep looking at my phone hoping his name pops up. He would text me every morning to tell me he loved me or give me words of encouragement. He was the funniest person I‚Äôve ever known. He had the best and most contagious laugh. He would send me memes when I was sad. He would buy me flowers and cherry coke for no reason. He started loving cats just because I did. He even saved money to help me fix up a room I could foster kittens in. He would do without so often just to surprise me or make me happy. Everyone always said they were shocked with how different he was with me. How much softer and more affectionate he was. It really made me feel special to be loved like that. On his 29th birthday last month I sang happy birthday to him and he would always joke about my bad singing but I could see how much he actually loved it in all of its awfulness. He always made me feel beautiful and important. God I miss him so much already. Sorry for the rant üíî

Thank you so much ‚ô•Ô∏è I‚Äôm still in shock and can‚Äôt believe he‚Äôs gone. I was still trying to absorb my dads death and cope with watching my mother die as well. This was so unexpected and hurts so much.

Thank you it helps to hear from someone with a similar experience.. I didn‚Äôt have nearly as long with my boyfriend, but the past 4 years he showed me what it truly meant to be loved completely and I‚Äôll never forget that or him. I don‚Äôt think i‚Äôll ever be the same.
thank you so much ‚ô•Ô∏è
thank you ‚ô•Ô∏è
i‚Äôll take custody of them, i‚Äôve handled dangerous criminals such as this before ü•∫
$confirm /u/AlpineOpera $775.00

Agreed! ESH. 

OP - By your description, you seemed rather unphased until he popped back up and admitted to being married. You made it seem as though you were perfectly okay with single motherhood, but suddenly after finding out the father is married, you rush to get child support first, essentially screwing his other children and his wife. 

You CHOSE to have a one night stand knowing the potential consequences and you also CHOSE to have your babies while having accepted the fact that you weren‚Äôt going to have any help. The phrase ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine‚Äù doesn‚Äôt exactly sound like something someone in dire need of financial assistance would say. 

He is DEFINITELY the biggest AH here, but no one in their right mind has a one night stand with someone they obviously barely know with expectations of anything more coming from it. You made a poor decision which led to a pregnancy that you decided to see through. Now five innocent children and their mother are financially trapped in a toxic household. How anyone could say that you‚Äôre completely void of any wrongdoing here eludes me.
$confirm /u/LimeyInYank $722.00

YTA, Do you think your gf enjoys having to do more than her share of chores because you half-ass all of yours? Leaving food on the counter is gross and can cause bug problems. Would you think it ‚Äòwasn‚Äôt a big deal‚Äô if you started having ant/roach problems and had to pay for an exterminator simply because you‚Äôre too lazy to wipe the counters down correctly? You make it sound as though she‚Äôs asking you to do things that are incredibly difficult. You‚Äôre 32. These are things my nieces and nephews do without complaint as preteens. Your girlfriend is right, time to grow up, pal.
she‚Äôs beautiful.

I‚Äôm sad to hear this, unfortunately it seems like many of us resort to destructive behavior. if you ever need to talk to someone I would be more than happy to listen or try to help. I also lost my dad so I can relate.

Thank you so much for this. I do have my days where i‚Äôm just unbearably sad but I find it‚Äôs mostly anger lately and I haven‚Äôt known exactly how to deal with it. I don‚Äôt want to project it on anyone who doesn‚Äôt deserve it, so I‚Äôm going to take your advice and let it out the way you said. There are a few really ugly bowls in my cabinet that probably won‚Äôt survive the night.
i‚Äôll look into this thank you
Yes.

I‚Äôm not really sure how your family dynamic works, but my brother and I are extremely close. He would never cut me out of his life for something like this. He‚Äôs put some of my exes in their place if he felt it was necessary. We‚Äôve always stuck up for one another, even if we don‚Äôt always agree on things, and more importantly I will ALWAYS stick up for a child in need, especially my nieces and nephews. I don‚Äôt care who‚Äôs feelings get hurt. I can agree that maybe screaming at her was not the right way to go about things, but since the other night 2 things have happened: 

1. I‚Äôve called CPS and reported her negligence. 

2. My brother has cut off contact with her and is going to focus on his own needs and the needs of his family. 

I would say those are two very positive outcomes.

My brother was in a rental home after his divorce. It might sound like I live with him, which I am around quite a lot to help with the kids, but I don‚Äôt actually live with him. I stepped up to help after his divorce so he could continue working and save to purchase another home. His now ex, aka bad mom, moved into an apartment on the government‚Äôs tab.

Thank you so much for that. I just want what‚Äôs best for everyone. I know how badly my brother wanted to help her but she‚Äôs a lost cause at this point and needs to help herself. His needs and more importantly his children‚Äôs needs are more important, as well as the welfare of his now exes daughter.

I‚Äôm so sorry. I was also very close to my grandpa who I lost in 2016. His son, my father, has also since passed away. I really hope you are able to find peace, the holidays are always the hardest after losing someone you love.

I may as well live with him. After his divorce, which was quite traumatic, he needed help with caring for his children. He runs his own business and works long hours. We are very close and his kids are extremely attached to me so I of course offered to step up and help with caring for them. I actually like helping out because the kids are happier this way.

I‚Äôm a female first of all. My brother would never punch me for saying anything. You‚Äôre condoning violence over words, but not the actual words. That‚Äôs an odd point of view, but to each their own.

I‚Äôm there because I care for his children and their well being. I‚Äôm their aunt so, yes, it does have to do with me. If I didn‚Äôt help care for them then he wouldn‚Äôt have the time with them that he does now. My brother knows my concerns and since posting this, has been receptive to them. Thank you for your feedback.
Sadly, she is in no position herself to push for anything involving the kids. :(
Yes they have been involved and will be again.
Our family dynamic is probably pretty different from most. We are very close and I chose to step up and help with his children after his traumatic divorce.
... I don‚Äôt want to LOL.
I can definitely respect your point of view. I was in the moment and very angry and possibly could have refrained from screaming.

I agree, it‚Äôs not good for them. I am currently talking with him tonight on and off as he packs and he seems very receptive to what i‚Äôm saying now after having time to think about things. He had a traumatic divorce and experience with the mother of his children so I think he really wanted to put in the effort for this relationship to work, but it‚Äôs just not realistic being that she refuses to get help or improve.

Thank you for this response. I realize some people will think he‚Äôs dumb or being a shitty father, but he‚Äôs truly a gentle and caring person. Anytime he sees her doing something questionable with her daughter he tries to correct it and help her. I think after talking with him tonight he‚Äôs coming to terms with the fact that perhaps everyone else is right and he should end the relationship and do what‚Äôs best for her daughter as well as his own family. It‚Äôs a hard thing to come to terms with, I expect even harder after his marriage of 15+ years failed before this.

Their mother isn‚Äôt really in a position to be able to do that, as she has her own issues as well. But I am definitely expressing my concerns to him and he seems more receptive tonight than previously.

I am honest with him about his poor choices but I don‚Äôt call him a shitty father. I talked to him a bit tonight and told him I was planning on reporting her to CPS and also expressed my concern for his state of mind.

I‚Äôve already said I would be contacting CPS and reporting her. I am not denying my brother is making poor choices, but I won‚Äôt call him a crappy father because I don‚Äôt feel that way. As I said before, you‚Äôre entitled to your opinion and I respect that.
I‚Äôm sorry for your loss as well, btw. It sucks losing a parent :(

I definitely think she deserved a much harsher punishment than she got, which was basically just a fine. My brother really went to bat for her by hiring a good lawyer who got most of the charges dropped.
thank you so much ‚ô•Ô∏è

Let me rephrase what I said in my post. He‚Äôs known her since high school, although not well, they were merely facebook friends until after his divorce. He didn‚Äôt go out and meet her, she messaged him and they started talking. There wasn‚Äôt enough character space to explain everything.

I won‚Äôt say anything bad about their mother, but there are definitely issues there. You‚Äôre entitled to your opinion and I can understand why you might feel that way, but I still think he‚Äôs a good father regardless. I think he‚Äôs making poor choices out of loneliness and possibly needs therapy to deal with what happened in his divorce. Maybe it could also provide some clarity as to why he puts up with this toxic person. Either way, I plan on talking to him more about it and helping however I can because his children deserve a safe and stable environment.

We are very close. If I didn‚Äôt help him care for his children and spend time at his house, he wouldn‚Äôt see his children hardly ever. He owns his own business and works long hours. I‚Äôm invested in his children.
That‚Äôs what i‚Äôm afraid of too :(
I commented this elsewhere but CPS was involved.
We‚Äôve discussed this more than once and I always remind him i‚Äôm here to help and to never let her transport his kids anywhere.
‚ô•Ô∏è

I have spoken to him briefly about things but I definitely think this is worth a shot, too so thanks for the idea. He seems to genuinely care for the child, was even painting a room for her and bought her a whole new wardrobe of clothes that actually fit her. He‚Äôs constantly buying her clothes and educational toys. He‚Äôs definitely the person who should be caring for her.
I commented this elsewhere too, but I have decided to report her to CPS and get them involved again.

she doesn‚Äôt live with him anymore, and he‚Äôs moving into the new house alone. i‚Äôm going to talk to him tonight about things but i‚Äôve pretty much made my mind up on the fact i‚Äôm going to call CPS and report her for neglecting her child. i don‚Äôt want her around my nieces or nephews anymore, and her child deserves better.
i‚Äôm sorry for your loss, too. it‚Äôs hard coming to terms with losing a parent,
Gotcha, yeah she shouldn‚Äôt be alone with any child period.

She‚Äôs not allowed to be alone with his kids. I asksd him if he doesn‚Äôt allow her to be alone with them or drive them places, how can he consider her to be a viable option for a gf or a good mother to her own child? It‚Äôs a huge mess honestly but hopefully he will come to terms with the fact that her poor decisions are turning into his own poor decisions as well. It really needs to stop.

Thank you so much for your comment. He literally told my older brother just hours before passing that he was finally at peace and could go without any worry. It definitely helped but still hurts very much.

don‚Äôt be sorry, it‚Äôs honestly nice to hear from someone who can relate so closely. thank you for sharing that, it hits so close to home. my father had a lot of friends who always said how kind, funny and giving he was. the pull of addiction was just too strong and took him away from us. i will forever miss him and my heart will always hurt in his absence üò¢

Her ex-husband who is not the child‚Äôs biological father was ready to adopt her last time he had her in his care. I think she would be much better off living with him again and she would also be in a home with her older brother as well.
Thank you so much for this ‚ô•Ô∏è

I haven‚Äôt outright asked him to choose between us and I wouldn‚Äôt. But, I do think you‚Äôre right, he needs to see his own self worth and remember his family deserves better. Pushing him to choose between us, even without saying it, will only drive him closer to her. Thank you for that point of view.
She‚Äôs never alone with my brothers kids, I‚Äôm always here with them if he‚Äôs not. But you‚Äôre right, I think at this point contacting them again would be in everyone‚Äôs best interest.

I have been in contact with her since the exchange and told her exactly why I was angry and why I didn‚Äôt feel the need to apologize. I have also, in the past, offered to go to meetings with her and help her get clean. My father was an addict who had a beautiful soul clouded by addiction so I do feel sympathy for those effected by it, including the addict. Unfortunately I was not able to include all of this in my post due to character limit.
CPS has previously been involved but I told another commenter I am seriously considering contacting them again since she had made no improvements since then.
This is exactly how I feel about my father. Amazing soul clouded by the darkness of addiction. I miss him so much and wish things could have been different.

YES! I have had this conversation with him many times and he seems so blinded he literally cannot comprehend that she‚Äôs just a shitty person and a horrible parent. She is NOT someone who should be around his kids, and by keeping her around he‚Äôs pushing me and his older children away. They do not like her and literally beg to be anywhere but home when she‚Äôs around. Thankfully, I think this argument between her and I has made things to come to a head and he‚Äôs going to have to face the music.

I‚Äôve seriously considered it. I‚Äôm only at my brothers so much because if I didn‚Äôt help him out with picking them up or dropping them off to school he wouldn‚Äôt have near as much time with them and as someone who recently lost their dad, I want him to get as much time with them as possible. He‚Äôs a great father, but has piss poor taste in women. She for sure needs to clean up her act one way or another.

I really honestly want nothing to do with her and as you said I really don‚Äôt even want to keep the peace at this point. Her mere presence annoys me especially when she‚Äôs being obviously neglectful to her child. This is someone who puts their child in a high chair and leaves her in it for over an hour at times just so she doesn‚Äôt have to deal with her or chase her around. I said something about that to her as well and she hasn‚Äôt done it around me since then.

It blows my mind too, I‚Äôve tried to have discussions about it with him before but he just refuses to believe that she‚Äôs a bad parent or person in general. It‚Äôs frustrating to see him put so much effort into someone who frankly is not worth a second of his time.
LOL god, I cringed. I don‚Äôt honestly know why he puts up with it, I think he‚Äôs lonely and just latched onto her following his divorce because he wasn‚Äôt used to being alone.
Thank you ‚ô•Ô∏è
Thank you, I don‚Äôt feel I should apologize either but he keeps insisting that I do so we can ‚Äòkeep the peace‚Äô. üôÑ

CPS did get involved and her ex-husband, who isn‚Äôt even the father of her toddler, was caring for her daughter while she was ‚Äòcleaning up her act‚Äô. They ofc let her have custody of her kid again despite the fact she‚Äôs made zero improvements. It‚Äôs so sad to me.
It really is. Thank you ‚ô•Ô∏è
Thank you ‚ô•Ô∏è
She‚Äôs beautiful. I am so sorry for your loss.

My condolences on your loss. Losing a parent is losing a huge part of yourself. I know the feeling all too well, and i truly hope you are able to find peace. Maybe one day the dinners will feel less painful and turn into more of a tribute to her and a time to share happy memories. ‚ô•Ô∏è

I truly hope you are both able to find some kind of peace as there‚Äôs really nothing anyone can say that will comfort you. It never makes sense when things like this happen. Watching someone you love suffer is incredibly painful and you often find yourself feeling quite helpless. I am so sorry you are and your SO are going through this. Prayers for you both.
he‚Äôs beautiful. i‚Äôm so very sorry for your loss. i hope you find peace ‚ô•Ô∏è

This is awful. My father was an addict who died from complications of years of drug abuse. He was a beautiful soul when he was sober and would have given someone the shirt off of his back. Unfortunately, the dark cloud that is addiction smothered his shining light until it finally went out. The state I had to see him in before he passed was scarring and awful, but obviously I was told he was going to pass, I didn‚Äôt have to find him in that state. I can‚Äôt even begin to imagine how you must feel having gone through such a traumatic experience. I do hope you find peace and that over time you will find reasons to live a good life, not just for him, but for yourself too. There really are no words that can comfort you during this time, but please know you are not alone. ‚ô•Ô∏è
lmaooo RT! this is way too relatable üò©

My father passed almost a month ago. My mom also had stage 4 cancer and my time is limited with her. I‚Äôm trying to cherish the day with her but I‚Äôm also grieving my father‚Äôs passing. It hurts a lot to lose a parent, and I feel your pain. I‚Äôm so sorry, there really aren‚Äôt words good enough to comfort anyone through something like this. I hope you find peace. ‚ô•Ô∏è
‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

I feel your pain.. my dad just died the end of November and my mom has stage four metastatic breast cancer that has spread all through her body. losing one parent and watching another suffer knowing you only have a short time with them is so painful. i should have so many more years with them and holidays to celebrate. i will cherish every second with my mom today, however, i‚Äôll also be grieving the loss of my dad. it feels so unfair.
i‚Äôm so sorry and heart broken for you that he‚Äôs gone, no words can ease your pain. he‚Äôs incredibly beautiful.
Merry Christmas to both of you. I hope you both enjoy every little second you have together as much as you can. It truly is precious.
he‚Äôs beautiful. i‚Äôm so sorry.

I‚Äôm so sorry for your losses and to hear you‚Äôre still struggling. It‚Äôs truly scary when I think of losing my mom and knowing it‚Äôs inevitable and coming soon and also knowing there‚Äôs nothing I can do to stop it. Losing my dad while knowing my mom is going to die was like a slap in the face. I have one surviving grandmother who doesn‚Äôt really like me all that much, she prefers my aunts kids over me and my siblings and it‚Äôs very obvious and always has been. I don‚Äôt want to feel like an orphan or feel even emptier than I do now. I feel like i‚Äôm desperately searching for connection with others, whether it‚Äôs friendship or something more, just so I don‚Äôt feel so alone and lost. I just want some stability in my life, I feel like I have no control. I really hope you can find a place that feels like home to you, and I hope we can both find our place in the world again.
I hope I can too. Her birthday is on the 13th and I hope to spend that day with her as well and spoil her as much as I can. Thank you again ‚ô•Ô∏è

I‚Äôm so sorry you lost your best friend. You‚Äôre right, those last minutes you have with them can be very traumatic and hard to talk about. I found it was easier to say these things here, to complete strangers, than it is to tell most of my friends who are young and haven‚Äôt really experienced any major losses yet. As I told another kind user who commented, I only have one friend who has lost a parent and we aren‚Äôt able to see or talk to one another much. 

I‚Äôll definitely look into some type of grief counseling at some point because all of this combined is taking a lot out of me and I know my emotional and mental states are both very fragile right now. 

I am helping care for my mom. I‚Äôve had to have home healthcare teach me to drain her lungs of fluid (she had in 2 lung catheters) and while I knew I was helping to relieve her pain and help her breathe a little better if only temporarily, it‚Äôs still a scarring process and something I will never forget. 

Thank you for the reassurance, I guess I just didn‚Äôt want to seem like I‚Äôm the only one suffering when I know there are others in the same or at least similar situations. Thank you again for your kind words as they mean a lot ‚ô•Ô∏è

Thank you for your kind words and it certainly helps to know I‚Äôm not alone. I only have one friend who‚Äôs lost a parent and we aren‚Äôt able to get together much and talk so in a way I feel like I have no one who can relate which is why I searched for this thread in hopes I could find people struggling with the same feelings. 

It does hurt to know neither of them will see me get married or have kids and that my kids would never know who either of them were aside from photos and me sharing memories. I already feel very alone and I‚Äôm scared of how much worse that will be once my mom passes. But, I am doing as you said; I tell her I love her constantly and I spend as much time with her as humanly possible, soaking up every minute I can. Again, thank you for your response and I‚Äôm so sorry for your losses. ‚ô•Ô∏è
Thanks so much ‚ô•Ô∏è
thank you ü§ç
Thank you, I will definitely be looking into this! ü§ç
Thank you! ü§ç
I was indeed! And i‚Äôm VERY grateful ü§ç I plan on paying it forward once i‚Äôm in a better position
Thank you so much for responding, I‚Äôm looking into therapy for the future it‚Äôs just unfortunately something I cannot afford at the moment.
Thanks so much!
Will do!
done!
um, that‚Äôs pretty creepy. luckily you were in a public place with your boyfriend nearby
That‚Äôs terrifying, I‚Äôm just glad your mother was able to get to both of you before the old woman took off with you.
